website_summaries.verdict: An affordable and versatile option that can be used for both hot and cold therapy. Excellent, leak-free quality makes this a solid choice for budget conscious buyers.
pros: Soft outer material boosts user comfort
Stitched edges improve durability and prevent leaking
Can be microwaved or submerged in hot water for heat therapy
Available in a variety of sizes
cons: Doesn't stay warm very long when used for heat therapy

customer_reviews.title: Goo on me
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine until it popped open and gooed all over me 5 days after the return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: William Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Leaked after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and for the first few days it was great! But as I started to use it in the microwave it started to give of a toxic smell. Then about 3 days later I microwaved the product and proceeded to use it, but when I noticed that it was leaking I threw it away immediately. I would not recommend this product to you.
customer_reviews.author: beth Knight

customer_reviews.title: I couldn’t figure out why my leg burned so bad until the pack completely melted and I realized there ...
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t figure out why my leg burned so bad until the pack completely melted and I realized there were multiple leaks on it. I haven’t been rough with the pack and I’ve only frozen it so I don’t understand why it happened. It’s been a week and the pain is still pretty bad. It’s extremely tender to the touch and a little bit swollen still, not to mention the random throbbing burning sensation. If I could give this no stars, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Perla

customer_reviews.title: Well made ice pack... Lasts & lasts!
customer_reviews.text: BEST SOFT ICE PACK EVER! No leaks...really well made! I've purchased the 3M ice packs for years & years & they leak at the corners in no time at all...such a waste of money! These Roscoe packs are made for longevity! Large sizes available as well, perfect for your back or wrapping around your whole foot or knee, shoulder etc. I will buy these & recommend them to others ALWAYS!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had purchased a larger size as it is just a bit too small to comfortable drape across the shoulders
customer_reviews.text: I am currently using this product as I write. It performs just as intended. I wish I had purchased a larger size as it is just a bit too small to comfortable drape across the shoulders. The only unremarkable thing worth mentioning is that my hot and cold pack does not look exactly as pictured. Instead, it has white bias tape around the edges. As the pack is around a quarter inch in depth, the heat retention is around half an hour if you stick with the recommended 50 seconds in the microwave at a regular power setting.
customer_reviews.author: The Choosy MooseTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: These leak after moderate use
customer_reviews.text: I purchase four of these less than two years ago. I needed them to use after foot surgery. They worked quite well until recently. All four of them started to leak within the past two weeks. The gel squeezed out of a seem which made a mess on whatever it touched. I liked them at first, but I would not buy them again. Leaking gel on my furniture is not a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: David Belling

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT.
customer_reviews.text: GREAT! Doctor told my boyfriend to use a hot pack to try to disperse a fatty area under the skin that had built up before surgery becomes an option. IT's been working pretty well. He likes it and I also used it when I was sick to try and bring down the temperature. Great product. HOT AND COLD.
customer_reviews.author: C. S

customer_reviews.title: The odor is real.
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the bad reviews which described a strong odor. I took it out of the packaging and tried to let it air out for a few weeks. It did not work. The odor isn't really strong, but enough to make me wonder what's inside this thing. Going to return it. I didn't try freezing, so not sure if that'll help.
customer_reviews.author: endershadow

customer_reviews.title: Quite thin for a gel pack
customer_reviews.text: I use freezer gel packs almost daily. I have a chronic pain near my tail bone which is relieved with the ice packs. Plus the usual tennis elbow, twisted ankle or stubbed toe. I bought this freezer pack by Roscoe hoping to replace one that I currently have that is cracking/leaking a little. I wanted to fit the Roscoe into the old cloth cover because it has elastic that I can wrap around my body. The wraparound elastic is the best if you are looking for something like this. I would probably return it if I had bought it locally. You may find it useful but I would hold out for the wraparound kind. Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: What's4dinner?

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, but doesn't hold cold temperature
customer_reviews.text: Matt's wife here. I've purchased many different brand and style ice packs for chronic migraines and degenerative cervical disc pain. Not very impressed with this Roscoe Icepack. It didn't keep the cold for more than 10-15 min, even rotating it around to use the different areas of cold. I know ice packs shouldn't be used for more than 15-20 minutes at a time. The ice pack also sweated a bit, leaving drops of water coming off, so I used a thin cloth to help with that. Definitely prefer ice packs that come with a cover. Only plus is that it's very flexible. Unfortunately, this was a disappointment and won't be kept as an ice pack in my ice pack rotation.
customer_reviews.author: Matt J

customer_reviews.title: A little lukewarm for an ice pack
customer_reviews.text: I keep quite a few ice packs around for migraines. This one seems durable enough. However, it's not particularly squishy so it's a little uncomfortable on my head. For other areas of the body, it's fine. I also feel like it doesn't get as cold as other ice packs (perhaps the durable outer coating?) and it doesn't stay cold for as long. I haven't tried it for heating.
customer_reviews.author: Sr Ogan

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful with this ice pack
customer_reviews.text: Caused excruciating pain with major ice burns that blistered after only a few days of having it. Made sleeping and moving difficult for days. Still hurts and looks terrible!! Now have to go to the doctor to get it treated. For someone that has back issues and uses ice packs all the time this was very frustrating causing more back pain. Idk if it was the chemicals or what but something was very wrong with the ice pack I received.
customer_reviews.author: Jess.1707

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just follow the directions.
customer_reviews.text: Top quality, better than drug store gel packs. The edges appear to be reinforced to help with leakage while using hot. I suggest you make sure you follow directions while heating to avoid damage to your skin from extreme heat and ruining the product. Fifty seconds in the microwave is plenty and any more will cause it to rupture.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ice pack
customer_reviews.text: This ice pack got me through recovery after clavicle surgery. I don't know what I would have done without it. It's easy to mold which made it good for my wound. It doesn't stay cold for a very long time, which at first I didn't like, but then I found out you're only supposed to ice a wound for 20 minutes at a time before you let it get back to temperature. In that time, I would just stick the pack back in the freezer and it was ready to go in an hour. The longer you leave it in the freezer the colder it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Joel and Carrie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Thin - doesn't contain much gel.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in anticipation of needing cold therapy after back surgery next week. I'm very unimpressed with how thin this is and how little gel is actually in the pack. I ordered another brand at the same time ($1 more, also 11x14) and it easily has MORE than twice the gel. With so little get filling I've got to imagine that this product isn't going to stay cold very long. at all. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: Too big for small areas, to small for large ones
customer_reviews.text: To use for the back it must be supported or you have to be lying down, or it cannot stay in place. It will only work on part of the back at a time. For a joint you need to tie a scarf or similar item to wrap in unless you only want it to sit in place. It is way to big for hand or finger pain relief. Stays cold for about 30 minutes, but cold is recommended for 20 minutes on and 20 minutes off by most doctors. The product recommends contacting your doctor. Excellent product for a small dollar amount and is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Ivanhoe

customer_reviews.title: I am no longer satisfied with these products
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about these products--I purchased both the medium and small size. They retain heat for about 1/2 to 3/4 hour if heated for the recommended time. They are very pliable and conform to your body easily. I have no leakage and no off-odors. EDIT: The fifth time I used the small sized one, it expanded greatly in the microwave and leaked all over everthing. YUCK!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blisters and leaks - manufacturing defect?
customer_reviews.text: We have bought two of the large size, which my 98 lb disabled wife puts on the seat of her wheelchair to control pain in her hip. I had noticed this white, slightly slippery material on her seat for the last several weeks, but couldn't figure out where it came from. It turns out that the cold pad has "blistered", and that gel slowly seeps through the blister. This looks like a manufacturing problem to me - like the material of the cover has delaminated. There are no tears, cracks or other leaks - the gel oozes through the blister. Odd. In the photo, the blister is visible in the upper left.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these cold packs! They are long lasting, and cold enough to help without being so cold you can’t use it. The flexibility of the packs make them very versatile, and the variety of sizes are great. I haven’t tried it as a warm pack, but I would totally recommend them for cooling.
customer_reviews.author: KKWie

customer_reviews.title: There is only one in the package
customer_reviews.text: I think the product is very good. would have left 5 stars except for the marketing. Even looking back at the amazon sight I think it is confusing as to not having all three sizes in the same package and price. I now understand , and did not complain to the seller, that each size is sold separately. I just think the add is not clear enough on that. I plan to keep it because The product looks to be very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: dennis white

customer_reviews.title: Form Fitting Cold Pack
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery on my face and have stitches next to my nose by my mouth. I used this cold pack every 15 minutes on the hour and the next day I had very little swelling. It gets cold enough that you may want to use a paper towel to line the pack from your skin. I liked this pack didn't get hard like a block of ice. I would highly recommend this pack for someone that wants to keep the swelling down within the first 24 hours of an injury or surgery.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Headache Be Gone!
customer_reviews.text: The Roscoe Hot & Cold Reusable Gel Pack is one of the best quality cold/ hot packs I've purchased. The cover is a very durable, vinyl type of material with a quality, sewn on edge tape of similar material to seal the whole thing. The pack is soft and flexible, and the gel inside doesn't get hard when frozen. I suffer from occipital neuralgia and Chiari Malformation, which cause horrid headaches, so having a moldable ice pack to place on my head that's soft is a must! It's so nice, I purchased another one in a different size ;)
customer_reviews.author: Brenda/Norse_Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Works better as a cold pack , bigger than thought
customer_reviews.text: Well first I will say is the reason I kept it is it’s a great material and quality. The thing is it heats up fast but doesn’t last long AT All. The other problem is it barely fits the brace I bought it for when it was the one reccomended it to go with this brace. So I can double it up and it’s huge bulky or Lay it straight and gave it stick out and not go under a shirt. I would give it a two for hot pack four for cold and quality and three for size and functional
customer_reviews.author: Brandy C.

customer_reviews.title: Best ice packs for freezer yet!!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with the purchase, fit in freezer, and comfort in application, that I've purchased the smallest and largest available from this company. The middle size was sold out...will check back and buy that one, too...as they save room in the freezer, but are the best ice packs yet (and, over the years, I've bought quite a few). Thank you, for the quality item and the speedy delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Irish 12

customer_reviews.title: The gel should stay in place
customer_reviews.text: The gel used in this product is very bad quality, it is too runny. The "GEL" thickness and spread should be consistent throughout the package. This one stays on one side or area of the enclosure. It does NOT work very well at all. The gel material is not thick or viscous enough to stay rather evenly overall. I would NOT recommend this particular product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Magicref

customer_reviews.title: Very useful size; Good item
customer_reviews.text: I had this in a smaller size for the elbow. Got this size (7.5") for the small of the back, but find it does the elbow even better than the smaller size. The perimeter seems to heat a bit more than the gel portion, i.e. almost too hot, but not too hot. It's fine, but it would be nice if they refined this aspect somehow. Most of the material seems to be vinyl. It's a very useful item
customer_reviews.author: Perry, the pretty good reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great gel ice packs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my mom to use after her hip replacement. They work great. The size is perfect, so she doesn’t have to use multiple ice packs. It conforms easily around the hip. Since it is a pack of 2, she always has another ice pack on the ready, versus having to refreeze before using again. Bonus, I was able to use my HSA debit card to purchase. I highly recommend for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Great Multipurpose Ice Pack
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this gel pack in preparation for wisdom extraction and it's such a great buy. The small size is great for the side of the face and as an ice pack to have around. I use this during the summer months to cool my neck and it can be warmed nicely for cramps and muscle soreness. My favorite way to use it is cold because it cools QUICKLY! The material of the bag is easy to clean and soft and smooth on the skin. Would repurchase in multiple sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Briana_Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Good for Sensitive Skin!
customer_reviews.text: I like this. I have a few of them but this one doesn't send you flying out of the chair when you put it on your bare skin. Some of those gel ice packs are so cold and clammy... Ugh. Not this one. I freeze it flat in the ice cube section of the freezer, and it is very pliable when I take it out of the freezer. As I wrote this review up, I went and got it for my poor aching shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: dianety

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I have only used it as an ice pack so far but I’m super pleased with it! It stays cold for a long time and is very flexible and isn’t hard or painful when placed on an injury. (I’ve been using it for an injured foot) it’s also FSA eligible which was a huge plus for us! Very pleased with my purchase. I look forward to trying it as a heat pack too!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Nace

customer_reviews.title: Super fast to heat up
customer_reviews.text: I do 40 seconds on this pack in microwave.. It helps with body aches and pains or occasional stiffness. I love the size because it is so bendable it works great at back of the neck or knee area. The heat seems to last a long time. Waaaay more time than my usual "bean type" of heat up pack. I haven't tried the freezable aspect yet but looking forward to it . Great product!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Gail Seminara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for icing after exercising
customer_reviews.text: I used these after therapy for a total knee replacement at my therapists. They worked so well and were so convenient, out of the freezer, in a towel, on my knee, and the ice therapy after exercising to reduce swelling lasted for the entire treatment without loosing it's cool (pun intended.) I highly recommend this procuct for any swelling where ice is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sugarntucson

customer_reviews.title: Cold, flexible, large size and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are unbeatable. I use the 11x14 to wrap around my lower legs and calf. They are flexible and stay freezing cold longer than any ones I've used in the past. These also feel more durable than the liquid style bags I've used in the past. I have not used them for heat yet but based on what they feel like at room temperature I believe would work well for that as well. I'm thinking about getting 2 more so I have 1 for each leg/arm in the freezer and then some in the cabinet for heat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hot/ cold pack for pain relief of back pain , shoulder pain ,or wherever you have sore muscles or pain It works as a hot or cold pack. I use it as cold mostly by freezing it and applying where it hurts. It numbs the area and reduces swelling to relieve back pain quickly. It has a thick outer covering so it does not get punctured easy, it is very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Woodworking Creations & More

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Does not stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item in a 2 pack back in August. My wife uses these items daily for her back. Back in November one of them has already leaked. We had better luck with a less expensive item that was just wrapped in a clear baggie looking material. For what I paid and what I assumed was a better constructed item, these guys are not cutting it.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with cold pack. Especially like the outer fabric covering that is not just slick plastic but a nice durable fabric and the edges are bound off nicely with a white edge trimming fabric. Must be an upgrade from the picture. At first, when frozen the pack feels rather hard. I would squish it a little in my hands and it quickly softens and becomes moldable to my hand and wrist. That is where I mostly use it for cold therapy for arthritis at base of thumb.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Heats up, but not to the desired temperature
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heating pad to help out keep my sons food hot for his lunch. The size is perfect and fits very well inside his lunchbox. The problem is that you can only heat it up in the microwave for 30s. If for some reason you try to heat it up a little more, it starts leaking a clear goo - the inside gel. Because of that, it heat's up into a mild temperature, and definitly wont hold up the heat for a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio Kopp Vanuzzi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Pregnancy Pain
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had back pain, so experiencing it while pregnant just sucks. As usual when I need something I turn to Amazon first and I found this gem for cheap, so I had to try it! It heats up incredibly quickly, it’s large enough to cover a bigger area and I also found it didn’t move out of place unless I physically changed position. Plus, it retains heat so well! Overall the value for money is amazing and I highly recommend this heat/cold pack.
customer_reviews.author: NESS_AUZ

customer_reviews.title: Thank You Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I needed an ice pack for my ankle. The one I bought at a local pharmacy started leaking after only a week of use. Took it back and searched here on Amazon. After reading all the positive reviews, I decided to purchase this product. So glad I did. The construction is very sturdy and even while frozen can be wrapped around my ankle. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Monica G.

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Best yet.
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it a 4 for pain relief because I will never be out of pain totally no matter what I do or take. There is only so much doctors can do. It is the best one yet it is flexible even when straight from the freezer. It fold and molds to your body comfortably with out having to defrost it partially first. Best one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Smells Bad, Occassionally leaks
customer_reviews.text: These work fine, but they have a pretty distinct smell to them. Occasionally mine would leak when I microwaved it... I always heated it for the maximum duration listed on the bag, so the leaking was quite probably preventable. I think most hot/cold packs will have this type of problem, hence the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Gel Pack
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Hot & Cold Therapy Gel Pack when I recently had a total hip replacement procedure. This size works great when I am sitting or if I am lying in bed. Think of using this on a "focused" area that needs ice, (ie)-the groin in joint area. The gel pac stays cold for a couple of hours. I would purchase this item again.The material used is of superior quality.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Good cold pack
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these. They stay pliable when frozen but are quite firm. I've had them both for awhile and they hold up well. Probably too small for a large shoulder situation or a bigger person, but they work very well for my kiddos' various injuries. I have had a couple of other brands that didn't hold up as well or weren't a good consistency when frozen. Would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: PT Mama

customer_reviews.title: Handy and good to have in the freezer
customer_reviews.text: This is just the perfect thing for me to keep in my freezer. I have been having knee issues lately and each morning after my walk, I grab them out and ice my knees. One day I put them directly against my skin and I literally had a freezer burn on my skin after that, so be careful! Follow the directions and don’t put it directly against your skin
customer_reviews.author: Brooke G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality But Doesn't Stay Cold Long
customer_reviews.text: For the longest time my family has had ice packs that freeze solid and I hated them. I get frequent migraines and it is so hard to hold them to my head because they aren't malleable and are stiff. These are amazing because they don't freeze solid. I was expecting the packs to be thin plastic, low quality like most Ice packs I've seen but the packs are made with this thick durable material. It is so durable I don't even need to put a washcloth around it. The only downside is that it doesn't stay cold long. Within 30mins it starts warming up.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia pawlak

customer_reviews.title: The gel pack doesn't heat proportionally so when you take ...
customer_reviews.text: The gel pack doesn't heat proportionally so when you take it out of the microwave, some areas are scorching hot while other areas are still cold, making it difficult to use. In addition, it loses its heat after 5-10 minutes whereas the clay heat packs that I used to use retained heat for more than half an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Kwan

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I work at fedex which is a very strenuous job. It takes a heavy toll on the body, especially the feet, legs, and back for me. I use everyday to recovery so I can go to work the next day. it stays cold for pretty long and hot for a good while too. I would have multiple to just always have a cold one around and one to heat too.
customer_reviews.author: ChelceeTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Need more!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing because I am allergic to the cold so I needed a pad I could heat easily. I need to get more because I find the boys stealing it from me and putting it in the freezer for when they get hurt. But it is just the perfect size. I deal with a lot of pain and having a heating pad helps with that.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron H.

customer_reviews.title: Well made! Hold up well to regular use!
customer_reviews.text: I have migraines & fibromyalgia & use ice packs constantly. These ice packs are great. I use them many times a day & so far they have held up quite well! I love that they come in many different sizes! ☆Don't bring them in your carry-on on a plane or they will take it from you! I was very disappointed to have mine taken on my way to a trip!!☆
customer_reviews.author: IndigoAngel925

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice ice gel pack. It is very comfortable and easy to use for sore joints. I'd say better than using an ice bag. I bought this originally to fit in my shoulder brace but also use it separately. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Mary S.

customer_reviews.title: A must for anyone who uses ice packs.
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful to keep in the freezer, somewhat pliable so you can use them to shape around everything from wrists, shoulder, knees etc. Ready for any injury, bite or aches and pains. I have one that is several years old and has been used frequently on arthritis and knee surgeries, allergic skin reactions etc. I bought a second one for my boyfriend after shoulder surgery.
customer_reviews.author: lgrin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and a must have
customer_reviews.text: I have never seen such a high quality ice pack! This is made with a thick material. The seams are secure and hidden under white trim. There is no leaking and no condensation. I did wrap it in a towel because I used it on my neck after a tonsillectomy and found it was too cold for that sensitive skin but I held it on my arm and it was perfect without the use of a towel. The fact that this can be heated is remarkable and makes this a truly versatile must have!
customer_reviews.author: KristyB427

customer_reviews.title: They are big and work.
customer_reviews.text: Thing 1st Gen iPad big. I love them put them in the freezer and iced my knee. They are big enough to fold over my knee and cover it completely. And stay cold enough for my 20 min on off routine. And they are reusable so on my next mountain bike fall I'll be good to go. Keeping them for sure.
customer_reviews.author: MIC

customer_reviews.title: plastic odor
customer_reviews.text: I use it as hot pack to put on my tired eyes. it did work well and made my eyes feel much comfortable and relax after using it. The size is about right and it did hold the temperature for a while. The only thing that disappointed me is the plastic smell. The odor is still here even already put outside for one month. :( not recommend for those with sensitive noses
customer_reviews.author: Chiaying Yen

customer_reviews.title: Great cold, not so great on lasting heat.
customer_reviews.text: Been having trouble with my knees - bought 4 of these to keep 2 in the freezer, and 2 out that I could microwave for heat. They stay cold for a good 30-45 min which is just what I needed! However, warming them up in the microwave, they get hot - but lose their heat quickly. I would say lukewarm by the 5 min mark. So great on the cold, but wish they would keep the heat longer. Using just as ice packs now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I guess I shouldn't have expected very much considering how cheap these were. They do their job, although they do lose the coldness pretty quickly. They're also really stiff. Not at stiff as solid icepacks, but the material is hard and doesn't bend well. They're decent for the price and work well enough. I've trying to use them on my neck and the white edging digs into my collarbones uncomfortably. Anywhere else they'd probably be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey M

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice if they had a strap to secure them in ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a smaller version of this hot/cold pack as well. I have to use heat on a knee injury and the smaller size covers the entire knee area and then I put this larger pack under my knee so I get heat for my hamstring and calf muscles. It would be nice if they had a strap to secure them in place, but I just use an ace bandage to keep them in place.
customer_reviews.author: Rah-Rah

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. I’m pregnant and my chiropractor told me to use cold instead of hot on my lower back pain. This is soft and flexible enough to be comfortable and the material keeps it from being too cold against my skin so that it doesn’t hurt while still being affective.
customer_reviews.author: ShandraLauren

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. It can used both hot and cold and works well for both. The fabric like cover is really nice. I have another that is a bit more plastic so I always have to use something between that and my skin. This one I don’t have to do that. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Trysha

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: These ice packs are just as high quality as the ace ice packs that are 2-3x more expensive. We’ve replaced all of ours with these. Warning! These are too cold to put directly on the skin! I got 2nd degree burns on my calf from placing directly on the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Madl

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality stitch &  uneven heating - Gel oozed out within a few days
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this product. The product was shipped and arrived on time. I followed the guidelines as a heat pack, used it in a 700watt microwave, and never heated it for a time greater than 50 seconds. - The Gel pack always heated unevenly, the areas around the logo was super hot compared to the rest of pack - I noticed that the gel pack had a single line of threading, which did not look durable. In about 7 days, gel started oozing out the gel pack making it useless
customer_reviews.author: Mark twain

customer_reviews.title: Cold works great.
customer_reviews.text: This works fine, it's a little thin and I didn't expect it to sweat after taking it out of the freezer. (I only bought this for the ice feature not the hot feature). However it does stay cold while using it. I only use it for 20 to 30 minutes at a time then back in the freezer for 30 minutes to an hour so it does what I want it to do. I just wrap it in a small hand towel to prevent the sweating from getting on anything else and it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: AZ4EVER

customer_reviews.title: High quality & durable packs!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I found these hot/cold packs. Love its sturdy, durable & flexible quality. Super easy to mold to any body part/joints where you need relief. I get a lot of use out of this 3 pc set especially when treating my ankle edema. These are very soothing on tired feet too! Highly recommend this Seller!
customer_reviews.author: Olga12

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should!
customer_reviews.text: This is an ice pack that does it’s job well. It freezes and refreshes well, it’s pliable when you need it to be and not too big. Our one complaint is that it is a plastic feeling fabric that was used. We purchased this one because we thought it was the soft fabric type, but it is not.
customer_reviews.author: stonelindseyr

customer_reviews.title: Keeps our Pekingese cool in the summer
customer_reviews.text: We wrap these in a towel pillowcase with velcro to keep our Pekingese cool in the summer. She is not a chewer, but we keep an eye on her, and we don't let her have one overnight. Any dog with a smooshed face or long hair with a thick undercoat would like them.
customer_reviews.author: Psyohe

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!  it takes forever to freeze and doesn't offer any pain relief
customer_reviews.text: i bought this product because i am a having terrible back pain. i thought the smaller size would make it more comfortable to use, which it would. but, this freeze pack doesn't get very cold nor does it remain cold enough to provide any relief what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: lindaSoCal

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It's very soft not hard as a rock and fits in its insert. Flexible with your body. Doesn't stay cold very long though.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: There’s almost no gel inside!
customer_reviews.text: It’s not great and pretty much a waste of money! I do not know if it’s mine that is defective, but it has almost no gel inside it to get cold/hot. I got the large size. Not happy with it. I gave it 3 stars coz they refunded my money.
customer_reviews.author: RAK

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst heat pack ever, the gel inside leaks out and can potentially burn your skin. The gel gets very hot but does not retain the heat well, wheat packs work better and are safer. I have only used it 2 or 3 times and already the gel leaks... not acceptable. I have never used it as a cold pack so I don't know how it performs when cold.
customer_reviews.author: Lys

customer_reviews.title: Great little ice packs!!
customer_reviews.text: We own probably 10 of these ice packs. They are made well, last long, and remain cold for a good length of time after you remove them from the freezer (I am sure a lot of this has to do with how cold your freezer is). They remain flexible even when extremely cold. I’ve never used them for heat, but use exclusively for cold.
customer_reviews.author: 0REDSOX7

customer_reviews.title: Fits Wraptor Ice Wrap
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the Wraptor Ice Wrap. I bought more than one of these gel packs. These packs stay cool for over 15 minutes. These gel packs are sturdy and firm, but moldable even when cold. Highly recommend, especially when buying the Wraptor Ice Wrap.
customer_reviews.author: twitchnln

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep on hand
customer_reviews.text: These get cold fairly quickly and feel cold out of the freezer. The cold doesnt last as long a side like but it lasts long enough. You should always have 2 or 3 so you can rotate what's in the freezer. They are nice and soft and clean easily.
customer_reviews.author: Handley Girl

customer_reviews.title: It works just fine but smells really bad (for a while, at least)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement when previous gel pack exploded in the microwave (it was a different brand & the explosion was my fault). This gel pack seems pretty durable & is the right size for my shoulder...but it smelled absolutely horrible for the first few months I owned it. I think the smell came from the outside material. I think it was just off-gassing as the chemicals in the fabric cured. Heating the gel pack really brought out the stink & the smell would stay with you for a little while after you used the gel pack. Anyhow - one year later, it does not smell at all.
customer_reviews.author: WaltR

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last worth a flip
customer_reviews.text: It failed... about a year, maybe a tad bit longer or shorter. But it's gone after very little actual use. It appeared to be a winner, frozen and ready for all of those injuries we dreamt of... only to be cut off in its prime and tossed overboard! Great while it lasted... Junk now. Looking for a competitor.
customer_reviews.author: W. Newsom

customer_reviews.title: Flexible but doesn't stay cold for long
customer_reviews.text: This pack might work better as a heat pack than as an ice pack. When 'frozen' the pack stays flexible, which could be helpful except it means that the pack doesn't get as cold as more rigid types. It also doesn't STAY cold for very long, so it isn't great for more serious physiotherapy care. But for treating minor injuries in-the-moment it could be very helpful, e.g. if you've sprained a finger or overtaxed your shoulder. Just bear in mind that it won't be very effective for serious pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Leak like crazy - just don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 large pads. Both leak like crazy after one-time use. I DID FREEZE them but didn't microwave. They worked just fine in the first a couple of hours but they leaked like crazy once they were defrosted. Contacted CS and got refunds. Don't get me wrong. I love Amazon but this item is just not worth it. It needs to be redesigned. I would suggest a disposable ice pack over this item.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Stay COLD for Relief
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for COLD relief. I keep in the freezer and use as needed. I have 3 of them and switch them out thru the night time hours. They stay cold for at least a couple hours for me. The are very durable as well and flex more as they melt. I'm very satisfied with this product. I haven't tried the HOT relief.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Super Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: super sturdy. Easy to clean. Great for pain relief. Always have two or more to swap out.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone Li

customer_reviews.title: Works well but doesn't keep cold long
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect size for my shoulder brace. It molds well to my shoulder in the brace. I just wish it stayed cold linger than 20-30 minutes. I have not tried it as a hot application, as I use a heating pad when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Just what i needed, bought two so one is always cold, fits perfectly under shoulder brace (for tendonitis) and stays cold for quite a while ... 20-30 minutes. (haven't tried with heat yet, but for cold pack I definitely recommend)
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I use this exclusively as a hot pack for warm compresses. I have used it almost daily for over 5 months. I warm it up in the microwave on medium power. Other brands have melted and leaked in a matter of a month or two. This one has a very sturdy cover on it.
customer_reviews.author: SeltzerTime

customer_reviews.title: Nice pad!
customer_reviews.text: I just got it the other day and used it tonight to ice my knee. It worked great! It remains flexible even when frozen and got mighty cold. I haven't used it for heat yet, though. I recommend wrapping it with a dish towel before applying it to avoid frostbiting your skin. Works very well! Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Danewfixer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Like the flexibility of this bag for small area. Since it doesn't have a cover, I use a thin sock.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality ice pack
customer_reviews.text: Nice, soft exterior. Perfect for injuries. It is relatively small so be sure it will fit the area you need iced. I used it for my lower back and it was a bit small. But for the price, it is a good quality.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousAmazonian

customer_reviews.title: Wide and light-weight
customer_reviews.text: I like that this cold pack is wide enough to provide full coverage of your back and even though it is wide, it is light-weight. I have only used it as an ice pack and not a heat pack yet though. I wish it had straps so that you can easily use it without having to hold it or use a belt.
customer_reviews.author: Andy S.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the icing effect and it works great. I have a broken femur so the large size covers my whole thigh. It's perfect and stays cold for a really long time. I can't comment on the heat aspect as I'm not using it for that.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Lawson

customer_reviews.title: A good size, but here are better options out there
customer_reviews.text: Extremely thin. You have to strap something around it or place something heavy on it to make it have substantial contact with your skin. If you simply lie it on your skin you won't hardly feel it. A good size, but here are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: ClaryTop Contributor: Cross-Stitch

customer_reviews.title: works great came on time and is as described, love it.
customer_reviews.text: works great and love it. Came in 2 days but originally stated 3 days. That is not what I pay to have Prime for and do not blame it on the Corona thing which is nothing but an excuse for people to be lazy
customer_reviews.author: buffalo bill..

customer_reviews.title: leaks
customer_reviews.text: It leaks..i got this about a month ago, used it maybe 3 times and on the 4th time after warming it up for 30 seconds in the microwave, it started leaking blue fluid from the stitch line. Also, heat does not distribute evenly so one side is hot and other side is cold (even with turn table in microwave).. disappointed in this purchase and now outside the refund period.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I love these cold packs. They are flexible and get cold enough to give excellent relief within about an hour and an hour and a half. I have experienced no odor al all. Perhaps that's because I’ve only used for cold therapy. At any rate, I’ve found the product to be just as described and am ordering another pair. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Heat-is a winner! Cold-is a loser!
customer_reviews.text: Packs work well heating them to the point of you can possibly burn yourself. It is the “cold therapy “ that is my problem! Packs don’t last very long once frozen! Loses coldness very very quickly! So I only give it 3 stars because of that!
customer_reviews.author: Pcolafun

customer_reviews.title: These suck. They are advertised as having a cloth cover
customer_reviews.text: These suck. They are advertised as having a cloth cover. They do NOT. These are no different than the ones for $2.50 at the nearest drug store. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Dave McPeek

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and simple
customer_reviews.text: Serves the purpose. Simple to use. Retains heat for long when microwaved for extra few minutes. Not heavy! Other products that I tried out in the interim were actually not useful at all in terms of retaining heat including an electric one. This one has been useful so far.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and works great and heat lasts long
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 small size. I had bad nerve issues in my upper back and used it as a hot pad was great. Just 30-50 seconds in the microwave kept it hot for about 30-45min long. I would say approx 10x4” for the small size. It’s a good item for the price I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: I got small size and based on the reviews. Used only once and for heat pack. The heating does not last beyond 10 minutes at a temperature that you need. It will need to be reheated every few minutes. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: I have three small ones and one large one. Since right now it's winter it's too cold for the cold one. So I primarily use the two small one as heat pads. They work better as heating pads because they retain heat well. When I used the large one or the other small one as cold pads. They don't last as long forty minutes at the most then you have to put it back in the freezer and wait two more hours before I can use them again.
customer_reviews.author: Allen C

customer_reviews.title: Smells awful
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Smells terrible. The first time I heated it, my husband walked in and asked why the whole room smelled like a hospital. I think it smells like burning plastic. I thought the smell would go away, but it's been a couple weeks and it still smells awful.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: So the photo completely tricked me. There’s just one. I rarely overlook these type of things. The photo is misleading. So the one I got is ok. It needs to have more gel. It doesn’t stay cold enough long.
customer_reviews.author: meliarocks

customer_reviews.title: Great cold or hot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these after back surgery, and then gave them to my daughter when she broke her ankle. I bought 2 more to keep for myself whenever my knee acts up, or my back. They have held up well, and I have used them for cold and heat therapy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Quality- best one I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Stays colder than other packs and for a longer period of time. Wish edges were a little smoother, but I can live with that. Stays very flexible even when frozen in an unusual position. Buying my second one today to use for car trips. I use on a shoulder and neck for chronic pain.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Stuebe

product_meta.title: Roscoe Reusable Cold Pack and Hot Pack – Ice Pack For Knee, Shoulder, Back, Injuries - Microwave Heating Pad, 5 x 10 Inches
product_meta.description:
Size:SmallOur Hot and Cold Gel Packs help reduce swelling that causes pain and substitute as ice bags for injuries. When used as a cold packs for therapy, it provides fast first relief for acute soft tissue injuries and other conditions that require cold applications to reduce bruising swelling and pain. When used as a hot therapy it provides long lasting soothing relief. It is a great source of muscle relaxation increasing blood flow to promote healing. It can also be used to soothe arthritis pain. It is the perfect solution to help relieve strains sprains headaches and other soft tissue injuries. This versatile gel pack is reusable and can be cooled in the freezer in as little as one hour or warmed in the microwave / hot water in as little as 50 seconds. This flexible ice pack can be molded to the body part even when frozen. When used as a heat pack, the pack should not be overheated in the microwave. Please follow the directions in the instruction manual. Manufacturer Contact Information 8003767263.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
8003767263
feature_bullets: REUSABLE ICE PACK - An ice pack for injuries that is made of durable, soft touch material. Our hot and cold packs for therapy are gentle on the skin and are also microwavable heating pads. A perfect ice pack for back pain, knee pain, and shoulder pain

MICROWAVE HEATING PAD – Applying heat from a heat pack causes increased blood flow to the injury area of pain. Hot packs for pain aid in the healing process by increasing oxygen to the body tissue and aid in the ability to stretch out pained muscles

MULTI-USE PACKS. Our cold packs for injuries can be used as a knee ice pack, ice pack for shoulder, back pain, neck pain, or can be reused for injuries where swelling occurs. Substitutes as an ice bag for freezer storage or as a microwaveable heat pack

FLEXIBLE HOT COLD PACK. Stays flexible to mold firmly to injuries, knee, back, ankle, shoulder etc. for targeted hot or cold compress and therapeutic relief from strains, sprains, or pains. Comes in small, medium, and large ice pack sizes

CRYOTHERAPY – It is recommended to use ice packs for injuries such as bruising, muscle spasms and swelling from acute sprains / strains. A cold gel ice pack can be applied a few times a day for several days after an injury or until it feels better

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
